content: furawa bonnet by michiko arai one size model has 53 3 cm/21 in circumference head gauge 25 sts x 20 row = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 in in stockinette stitch on 3 5mm/us 4 needles or size needed to achieve gauge size up in needle if you get more than 25 sts per 4 inches size down if you get less than 25 sts per 4 inches needles 3 5mm/us 4 circular needles in 24 or greater length double pointed needles for i-cord in same size or whatever size needed for proper i-cord gauge materials 50g 2 balls of cardiff cashmere classic 25g = 110 m/20 yards so 50g = 220 m/240 yards the sample used 34g or approximately 150 m/164 yards total so you will probably have left over if you buy 2 ball of cardiff classics alternatively use a comparable sport weight yarn pattern overview the furawa bonnet is worked from the top down after knitting a square for the crown of the head stitches are picked up around three edges of the square and the flower eyelet pattern begins as you knit the body of the bonnet decreases are knit at the base of the hood for a better fit around the jaw/chin finally stitches are picked up around the base and the face edge and an i-cord is knit all the way around these edges for a finished look/ties to secure the bonnet instructions bonnet crown you will knit a square that forms the crown of the bonnet as follows co 28 sts using the longtail cast on beginning with a purl row knit back and forth in stockinette st for 42 row or until it measures approximately 10 cm/4 in end after a working a rs knit row break yarn leave the sts on hold on the needle looking at the square from the rs and use the left needle to begin picking up sts at the right end of the co row pick up and knit 29 sts on the right edge of the square knit across the stitches that were on hold then pick up and knit 30 sts on the left edge of the square the pick-up rate is approximately 2 out of 3 with a few extra added in turn the work and purl back across all 87 sts 30 sts from the left edge 28 sts that were on hold 29 sts from the right edge bonnet body you will work the flower pattern throughout the body of the bonnet as follows 1 row 1 rs knit row 2 purl row 3 k3 *yo ssk k6 repeat from * to last 4 sts yo ssk k2 row 4 purl row 5 k1 *k2tog yo k1 yo ssk k3 repeat from * to last 6 sts k2tog yo k1 yo ssk k1 row 6 purl row 7 k3 *yo ssk k6 repeat from * to last 4 sts yo ssk k2 row 8 purl row 9 knit row
